reasoning: Reporting incidence of new diagnoses. Hyperdiploid B-ALL represents ~25-30% of childhood B-ALL cases. With pediatric ALL incidence ~4 per 100k children and hyperdiploid being 25-30% of B-ALL cases, estimated ~1.2 per 100k overall population.
source: Pui CH et al. (2004). Childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia: progress through collaboration. J Clin Oncol. 22(15):2902-2913
